title: Press Mat For Industrial Lamination Process, "Copsil Gold™ Press Mat", designed 1994, manufactured 2005
medium:
Medium: brass, copper, silicone
Technique: herringbone twill weave
dimensions: Maximum available width: 300 cm (9 ft. 10 1/8 in.)
description: Woven herringbone twill of brass wire warp and silicone-covered copper wire weft maximizes heat transfer through the press mat, while equalizing the pressure being applied to the laminate and preventing shifting of the mat during the lamination process.
justification:
This woven brass and copper fabric, used as a press mat for industrial lamination processes, employs a silicon-elastomer in the weft to prevent deformation of the weave under compression.&nbsp; Textile structure is of the utmost importance to the ultimate performance of the fabric as the herringbone twill weave produces a flat surface with high brass content, maximizing thermal efficiency, while the reversal of the herringbone balances the spring of the elastomer to prevent mat shifting.&nbsp; 
The Cooper-Hewitt collection contains historic and contemporary examples of the herringbone twill textile structure, but none with a purely industrial application.&nbsp;The Copsil Gold Press Mat demonstrates the strength of these fibers and textile structure, while revealing the unintended beauty of industrial textiles.

type.name: Press mat for industrial lamination process

tombstone.epitaph:
Press Mat For Industrial Lamination Process, "Copsil Gold™ Press Mat", designed 1994, manufactured 2005. Medium: brass, copper, silicone
Technique: herringbone twill weave. Gift of Marathon Belting Ltd.. 2005-28-1.
